output.input_text:
MRI Brain with ContrastHeadache, rule out mass or demyelinating diseaseFindings:
Brain Parenchyma: No evidence of mass, hemorrhage, or infarct. Normal gray-white differentiation.
Ventricles and CSF Spaces: Normal in size and configuration; no hydrocephalus.
Basal Ganglia, Brainstem, and Cerebellum: Unremarkable.
Pituitary Gland: Normal in size and signal.
Orbits: Normal. No evidence of optic nerve enhancement.
Contrast Enhancement: No abnormal enhancement noted.
Diffusion-Weighted Imaging: No restricted diffusion to suggest acute infarction.

Impression:
No acute intracranial abnormality.
Normal MRI of the brain.
keywords: ContrastHeadache, rule out mass or demye
